Is this not what you are expecting?

text:
thanks <@UQL0QDEKA> So i've moved to a AWS t4g, and no latency issues anymore,which is progress.
However, bot still having issues which looks like a coding bug of mine, it's interesting it's taking a while to develop given this version of the instance has been running a month, but this week my "hedging" is failing, and i'm getting loads of these exceptions:
```Order does not currently have a betId```
Which is odd, unfortunately it's in my hedging logic, I need to handle it better I think.
But <@U4H19D1D2> how does an Order not have a betId ?

text:
<@U4H19D1D2> I have enabled info logging for tomorrow, i've reduced to just WIN markets to reduce the amount of logs.
I've determined the hedging cancel & place_order transaction code:
```                            with market.transaction() as t:
                                if old_order:
                                    t.cancel_order(old_order, force=True)
                                t.place_order(order, force=True)```
when it fails, which is not always, the old_order is successfully cancelled, but the new order placed never makes it to Betfair (I see no history via web) and immediately appears in the process_orders() as OrderStatus.EXECUTION_COMPLETE, and the status log is:
```"status_log\": \"Pending, Execution complete\"```
I'll see what I can gather from the info logs...

elements.text:
I have enabled info logging for tomorrow, i've reduced to just WIN markets to reduce the amount of logs.
I've determined the hedging cancel & place_order transaction code:

with market.transaction() as t:
                                if old_order:
                                    t.cancel_order(old_order, force=True)
                                t.place_order(order, force=True)

when it fails, which is not always, the old_order is successfully cancelled, but the new order placed never makes it to Betfair (I see no history via web) and immediately appears in the process_orders() as OrderStatus.EXECUTION_COMPLETE, and the status log is:
"status_log\": \"Pending, Execution complete\"
I'll see what I can gather from the info logs...
